subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 5, 2007

TOP STORIESCops Search For Missing Kansas Teen
Police in Overland Park, Kan., are looking at a surveillance video showing a missing 18-year-old girl being forced into her
                        car at a Target store where she had shopped. They're hoping the video will help locate a person of interest in the case. More...
• "Scooter" Libby Gets 30 Months In Jail
                     					| Watch• 4th JFK Terror Suspect Surrenders
                     					| Watch• Transplant Team Crash Survivors UnlikelyU.S.Mom AWOL Over Child Custody To Surrender
A National Guard member in Iraq received emergency leave when her ex-husband was arrested on abuse charges while caring for
                        their daughter. As she fights for custody, the Army has declared her AWOL and may throw her in prison.  More...
• 4th JFK Terror Suspect Surrenders
                     					| Watch• Transplant Team Crash Survivors Unlikely• Extreme TB Patient's 3rd Test Is Negative
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldPolish Teen's Holocaust Diary Revealed
The chronicle by the "Polish Anne Frank" was kept by a non-Jewish friend for more than 60 years before it was turned over
                        to Israel's Holocaust Museum. "I'm turning into an animal waiting to die," wrote Rutka Laskier. She did, in August 1943. More...
• Group: Olympics Force Mass Evictions• Bush: Putin Has "Derailed" Democracy
                     					| Watch• Castro Interview To Air Tuesday• More StoriesPoliticsHillary: Faith Got Me Past Bill's Affair
In a rare, frank comment about her husband's infidelity, Sen. Hillary Clinton said her faith in God got her through his affair.
                        She was speaking with other Democratic presidential front-runners at a forum on faith and social justice. More...Watch: Hillary 'A Woman In Charge'
• Wyoming Senator Craig Thomas Dead At 74• "Scooter" Libby Gets 30 Months In Jail
                     					| Watch• Catholic Bishop Raps Rudy On Abortion• More StoriesHealth9 Tips To Keep Young Athletes In The Game
To reduce injury or burnout, child and teen athletes should take 1 to 2 days off from sports per week, says the American Academy
                        of Pediatrics.
                         More...
• Extreme TB Patient's 3rd Test Is Negative
                     					| Watch• "Genius Pill" May Relieve Chemobrain• At-Home Kit Tests Man's Fertility• More StoriesSciTechThousands Flee Oman's Coast Before Cyclone
Cyclone Gonu, with winds gusting up to 195 miles an hour, is heading toward the oil-rich Persian Gulf region. Most of Oman's
                        key oil facilities are on the northeastern coast and not directly in the storm's projected path. More...
• Did Chickens Beat Columbus To New World?• Can Ask.com Take A Bite Out Of Google?• Komodo Dragon Kills 8-Year-Old Boy • More StoriesBusinessBillionaire Burkle May Bid For Dow Jones
The Independent Association of Publishers' Employees union says billionaire investor Ron Burkle is interested in exploring
                        a bid for Dow Jones & Co., publisher of The Wall Street Journal. More...
• U.S. Auto Slump Moves Beyond The Big Three• Fed Chief: Economy To See Moderate Growth• The Unvarnished Truth About Savings• More StoriesEntertainmentBrangelina Bonds At Bath Time
Angelina Jolie says her partner Brad Pitt has a knack for bringing her out of her shell. "I don't know how he does it, but
                        ... I talk a lot in the bath," she says. "Get naked with me, and I'll talk!" More...Watch: Brangelina Arrives At Cannes
• Clarkson Letters Read At Spector Trial• Fresh Look At Princess Di
                     					| Watch• Oprah Talks To Reclusive Novelist• More StoriesOpinionHedge Hogs
Hedge fund managers can pull in more than $1 billion a year, yet face a much lower tax rate than people who make far less
                        than them, all thanks to a distorted tax structure supported by conservatives, says The New Republic. More...Watch: MoneyWatch
• GOP Must Focus On The Family
                     					| Watch• A Lot To Love In Immigration Bill
                     					| Watch• Containing The Chaos In Iraq
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Recipes: Taste Of Home's Winning Vegetable Recipes
Taste of Home magazine has sponsored a cooking contest for vegetable recipes which they call Garden's Bounty. The winning
                        recipe, for a fresh tomato sauce served over spaghetti squash, makes an ideal vegetarian entree or a light summer lunch.  More...Watch: Harvesting A Winning Recipe

Kevorkian: Death A Given RightCBS News RAW: Following his release from prison, assisted suicide advocate Dr. Jack Kevorkian maintained that death
                                    is a natural right that the U.S. legal system withholds from its citizens.
